DataElement.preferredName: Central Nervous System Neoplasm Bone Present Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not a central nervous system neoplasm was present in the bone.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Central Nervous System Neoplasm Bone Present
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Abnormal growth of cells that comprise the tissues of the central nervous system (brain and spinal cord), without designation of benign or malignant nature._Connective tissue that forms the skeletal components of the body._Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Abnormal growth of cells that comprise the tissues of the central nervous system (brain and spinal cord), without designation of benign or malignant nature.

Concepts.definition: A benign or malignant, primary or metastatic neoplasm that affects the brain, meninges, or spinal cord.  Representative examples of primary neoplasms include astrocytoma, oligodendroglioma, ependymoma, and meningioma.  Representative examples of metastatic neoplasms include carcinoma and leukemia.

Property.preferredDefinition: Bone; a rigid connective tissue that makes up the skeleton of vertebrates.:Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: The structural organ comprised of specialized connective tissue that forms the skeletal components of the body.
Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.
